definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: There are twin holes on each side of the instrument.
sentences.chinese: 這工具的兩邊各有一對孔眼。

sentences.english: Squeeze cementing uses pressure to force the cement through holes or perforations in the casing.
sentences.chinese: 擠水泥時在壓力下將水泥漿壓經套管中的射孔孔眼。

sentences.english: Measure the total length of the tension cable from centre of eyelet to centre of eyelet with a tape measure .
sentences.chinese: 用捲尺測量張緊拉線孔眼中心之間的整體長度。

sentences.english: Drilling ceramic tile requires a speical bit.
sentences.chinese: 這種鑽頭鑽的孔眼很小。

sentences.english: He inserted the wooden peg into the hole.
The holes for the bolts registered perfectly.
The stove has a hole to allow the smoke to escape.
sentences.chinese: 這爐子有個孔眼讓煙冒出去。

sentences.english: An aperture mask assembly includes a rotatable frame and a mask having apertures.
sentences.chinese: 一種孔眼掩模組件包括可旋轉機架和具有孔眼的掩模。

sentences.english: An aperture mask assembly includes a rotatable frame and a mask having apertures.
sentences.chinese: 一種孔眼掩模組件包括可旋轉機架和具有孔眼的掩模。

sentences.english: Measure the total length of the tension cable from eyelet to eyelet with a tape measure .
sentences.chinese: 用捲尺測量張緊拉線孔眼之間的整體長度。

sentences.english: We have been given the school papers with holes already  punched in them to fit into the binders.
sentences.chinese: 我們已拿到打有孔眼適於裝訂的學校用紙。

sentences.english: It is extremely easy to fix, thanks to its eyelets.
sentences.chinese: 它的孔眼使它易於固定。

definition: to bore a hole/to drill/drilled hole
